newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanese judge releases leftist labour leader.
newsitem.headline: Lebanese judge releases leftist labour leader.

text.p: A judge on Saturday ordered that leftist labour leader Elias Abou Rizk be released after eight days in jail for claiming to head Lebanon's divided labour movement, judicial sources said.
They said investigative judge Said Mirza ordered Abou Rizk released on bail of 400,000 Lebanese pounds ($260) after rival unionist Ghneim al-Zoghbi's lawyer agreed.
Abou Rizk was arrested after General Labour Confederation (CGTL) elections in April produced two leaderships -- one headed by him and one by Zoghbi, who was recognised by the government.
The release of Abou Rizk pending trial is a sign the split is on its way to being solved, unionist sources told Reuters.

Abou Rizk, who was seeking a second four-year term as CGTL chief, harried Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri during his first term with general strikes and demonstrations to demand better conditions for workers.
Abou Rizk's campaign against the government gained wide support from the opposition and he came close to winning election to parliament on a leftwing ticket last summer.
